intro: Oligochaetochilus mystacinus, commonly known as the misty moss, is a species of moss that belongs to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in small, translucent cells. This moss typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks. The plant plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
